summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York City residence and private island in the Virgin Islands. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the warrant; devices were seized from his person and his residences. The investigation is for violations including sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The search seeks evidence of communications with her.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI. Two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person during this arrest.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York City residence, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James, Virgin Islands
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Warrant Issued for Device Search
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant authorizing the forensic examination of the 62 seized devices.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Jeffrey Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties: 2 from his person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.
The search is for evidence of specific federal crimes: sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. 1591), transportation of minors (2422), enticement to travel (2423), and conspiracy (371).
The warrant authorizes a search for a wide range of evidence, including communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs of victims or potential victims.
The warrant was issued on June 26, 2020, nearly a year after the devices were seized and approximately 10 months after Epstein's death in August 2019.
